channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: What's on TV this week: 'Them,' 'Thunder Force' and 'Republic Commando'
item.description: This week Netflix premieres a new superhero flick with Melissa McCarthy and a Dolly Parton tribute.

item.title: Facebook's line of PC-only VR headsets ends as Rift S stock dries up
item.description: The Oculus Rift S stock is drying up and Facebook says it won't be replenished as it focuses on standalone VR headsets.

item.title: Discord banned 2,212 servers for extremist content in the second half of 2020
item.description: Discord also deleted 30,000 accounts for promoting violent or extremist content.

item.title: Season two of 'Star Trek: Lower Decks' hits Paramount+ on August 12th
item.description: Animated comedy 'Star Trek: Lower Decks' gets a second season on Paramount+ this summer.

item.title: The new season of 'Star Trek: Discovery' debuts later this year
item.description: 'Star Trek: Discovery' season four will debut later this year on Paramount+.

item.title: Yahoo Answers is shutting down on May 4th
item.description: Pour one out for one of the web's oldest Q&A websites.

item.title: Democratic lawmakers ask Facebook to detail its Instagram for kids project
item.description: A group of four Democratic lawmakers says they're concerned with the company's plan to build an Instagram for users under the age of 13.

item.title: 'Star Trek: Picard' season two will debut on Paramount+ in 2022
item.description: 'Star Trek: Picard' season 2 will debut in 2022 with an old frenemy in tow.

item.title: Zoom now works on Amazon's Echo Show 10
item.description: Amazon Chime is also available on the smart display.

item.title: Someone made a playable, TV-sized Nintendo Switch
item.description: This Switch comes in at 30 inches tall and 70 inches wide, making it impossible to touch two buttons on opposite sides of one another without stretching out as far as you can.

item.title: Google opens up the Play Store to more Android Auto apps
item.description: Android Auto users will soon see a greater variety of navigation, parking and charging apps on the Play Store.

item.title: Supreme Court vacates ruling that prevented Trump from blocking Twitter critics
item.description: Not that it matters too much for Trump anyway after Twitter permanently banned him.

item.title: TP-Link's latest WiFi 6 router packs 4.8Gbps speeds at a reasonable price
item.description: TP-Link has introduced the Archer AX5400, a WiFi 6 router that promises 4.8Gbps connections at a semi-affordable price.

item.title: 8Bitdoâ€™s Pro 2 sneaks premium features into a $50 gamepad
item.description: At first glance, 8Bitdo Pro 2 looks almost identical to its predecessor, but with two new button bumpers underneath the controller, it's even more appealing for a $50 controller.

item.title: Master Git and GitHub with this $25 e-learning bundle
item.description: Packed with four hours of content, this bundle will teach you the best practices for using Git and GitHub to save your work in stages, seek feedback and get recruited as a programmer.

item.title: 'Loki' trailer previews a multi-dimensional, time-traveling adventure
item.description: The MCU's god of mischief returns on June 11th on Disney+.

item.title: Supreme Court rules in Google's favor in Oracle copyright case
item.description: Today, the US Supreme Court ruled 6-2 in favor of Google in the company's long-running legal battle against Oracle.

item.title: Netflix, Apple and Disney were big winners at the SAG Awards
item.description: Netflix, Apple and Disney+ were big winners at the SAG Awards, with 'Ma Rainey's Black Bottom' and 'Ted Lasso' among the highlights.

item.title: Beats Solo Pro wireless headphones drop to $145 on Woot
item.description: Save more than 50 percent on the Beats Solo Pro wireless headphones at Woot.

item.title: Theragun's pricey massage gun delivers on its muscle recovery promise
item.description: The Theragun Elite is a percussive therapy massage gun that helped my sore muscles recover from workouts and alleviate aches and pains.

item.title: The Morning After: LG quits the smartphone race
item.description: Todayâ€™s headlines: LG quits the smartphone race, scientists demonstrate how DNA can be collected from the air and Hyundaiâ€™s Genesis broke the world record for the most drones in the sky.

item.title: Federal labor agency says Amazon illegally fired climate activists
item.description: Amazon illegally retaliated against two former employees after it fired them for staging climate and workplace safety protests last year, according to federal labor regulators.

item.title: Samsung's Adidas-branded Galaxy Buds Pro come in a snapback-shaped case
item.description: Samsung is doing some co-branding with Adidas as a way to create some buzz around its wireless earbud products, while buffing up its eco-friendly bonafides.

item.title: LG confirms it's shutting down its mobile business
item.description: LG is shutting down its struggling mobile business after failing to reverse years of losses.

item.title: Genesis broke a world record for the most drones in the sky
item.description: Hyundai's Genesis brand just broke a world record for the most drones airborne at the same time, putting 3,281 UAVs in the air for a publicity stunt.
